summary: This is a service request form from the Federal Bureau of Prisons (FBOP) Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York, dated September 24, 2019, requesting phone support for the installation of a new NICE Vision system, specifically for creating users and profiles. It indicates technical setup work at the facility where Jeffrey Epstein was held.

events.title: NICE Vision System Service Request
events.description: A service request is created by the FBOP MCC New York for phone support to assist in creating users and profiles during the installation of a new NICE Vision system.

locations: FBOP MCC New York MS0109 (130104.001), NEW YORK, NY 10007
keyFacts: The document is a service request from the Federal Bureau of Prisons Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York.
The request, dated September 24, 2019, is for phone support to assist with creating users and profiles for a new NICE Vision system installation.
The request is marked as a priority and an emergency, requiring a call the same day.
The location is the FBOP MCC in New York, NY 10007, which is the facility where Jeffrey Epstein was incarcerated.
The document is part of a technical or administrative record related to facility operations, not a legal or investigative document concerning Epstein's activities.
